entries.statement: Write real integration and unit tests — never use mocks or stubs unless testing external service boundaries
entries.rationale: Mocks hide integration bugs and create false confidence in test suites

entries.statement: All new code must have test coverage. Target near-full coverage for business logic
entries.rationale: Untested code is a liability — agents should not ship code they cannot prove works

entries.statement: Run the build and all tests before reporting task completion
entries.rationale: Broken builds waste review cycles and erode trust in agent output

entries.statement: Follow existing patterns in the codebase. Search for similar implementations before creating new patterns
entries.rationale: Consistency reduces cognitive load; new patterns require justification

entries.statement: Never suppress linter or compiler warnings without a documented justification
entries.rationale: Suppressed warnings hide real issues and accumulate technical debt

entries.statement: Keep changes focused. Don't refactor surrounding code unless it's part of the task
entries.rationale: Scope creep makes reviews harder and introduces unrelated risk

entries.statement: Read relevant code before modifying it. Never propose changes to code you haven't read
entries.rationale: Blind modifications break assumptions and miss existing constraints

entries.statement: When encountering repeated failures (3+ attempts), stop and reassess the approach rather than continuing to iterate
entries.rationale: Repeated failures signal a wrong approach — iteration without reflection wastes resources
